skill.name: wp-plugin-development
skill.description: Use when developing WordPress plugins: architecture and hooks, activation/deactivation/uninstall, admin UI and Settings API, data storage, cron/tasks, security (nonces/capabilities/sanitization/escaping), and release packaging.

skill.author: Automattic

security_audit.summary: This skill provides documentation and guidance for WordPress plugin development. It includes a Node.js script for detecting plugins that reads filesystem content but is constrained by ignore patterns and depth limits. No network calls, credential access, or code execution beyond its stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Creating WordPress plugins requires understanding complex hooks, lifecycle management, and security practices. This skill provides expert guidance for plugin architecture, Settings API integration, and secure development patterns.
actual_capabilities: Create and refactor WordPress plugin structure with proper architecture
Implement activation, deactivation, and uninstall hooks with best practices
Build admin settings pages using WordPress Settings API
Apply security measures including nonces, capabilities, sanitization, and escaping
Manage data storage options and cron tasks in plugins
Package plugins for release with proper build artifacts and readme files
limitations: Does not execute PHP code or install plugins on a live WordPress site
Does not provide hosting or deployment services
Does not modify database schema directly without guidance
Does not generate complete plugin code from scratch without user input

use_cases.title: Create New Plugins
use_cases.description: Set up proper plugin structure, hooks, and lifecycle management for new WordPress extensions.

use_cases.title: Add Settings Pages
use_cases.description: Build admin interfaces using Settings API with proper sanitization and capability checks.

use_cases.title: Fix Security Issues
use_cases.description: Implement nonces, escape output, use prepared statements, and apply capability verification.

prompt_templates.title: New Plugin Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new WordPress plugin with proper structure. Include a bootstrap file with plugin header, a loader class for hooks, and activation/deactivation handlers.

prompt_templates.title: Settings Page
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a settings page to my WordPress plugin using the Settings API. Include register_setting, add_settings_section, and proper capability checks.

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my WordPress plugin for security issues. Check for proper nonce validation, capability checks, input sanitization, and output escaping.

prompt_templates.title: Release Package
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare my WordPress plugin for release on wordpress.org. Include proper readme.txt, build assets, and verify all security requirements are met.

best_practices: Always validate and sanitize input early, escape output late
Use nonces to prevent CSRF attacks combined with capability checks for authorization
Store schema version and provide upgrade paths when modifying database tables
anti_patterns: Avoid processing entire $_POST or $_GET arrays; read explicit keys only
Never concatenate user input directly into SQL queries; use $wpdb->prepare()
Do not register activation hooks inside other hooks or conditional blocks

faq.question: What WordPress versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: Targets WordPress 6.9+ with PHP 7.2.24+. Some features require WP-CLI for testing.

faq.question: What are the limits on plugin complexity?
faq.answer: The skill handles single-site and multisite setups. Complex plugins may need additional architectural guidance.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Works with WP-CLI for command-line operations. Provides guidance for integrating with build tools and CI/CD.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a guidance-only skill. No code execution or file modifications happen without explicit user direction.

faq.question: Why is my settings page not saving?
faq.answer: Check that register_setting is called, option group matches form, capability and nonce are verified, and sanitize_callback is defined.

faq.question: How does this compare to other development skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses specifically on WordPress plugin patterns. General PHP skills cover syntax; this covers WordPress APIs and conventions.
